response.overview: What is the Quiksilver Crossing?  The Quiksilver Crossing is a voyage of surfing discovery on board the surf explorations vessel, the Indies Trader. The boat left Papua New Guinea in March 1999 and has journeyed east across the South Pacific, Indonesia and the Mentawais, across the Indian Ocean to the Maldives, South Africa, through the Mediterranean to Europe, Brazil, Central America, the Caribbean and the USA. Scientific data is being collected on isolated reefs and this is being collated for the Untied Nations supported reef Check program. Another important aspect of the Crossing is respect for, and interaction with, local cultures. Sit back and watch the world's best surfers captured on film, surfing and exploring the world's most remote locations on The Quiksilver Crossing.
response.title: The Quiksilver Crossing
